title.narrative: Papouasie-Nouvelle-Guinée (la): Aide ciblée aux pays
Papua New Guinea: Targeted country assistance

description.narrative:
Plans d’assistance technique ciblée aux pays L’assistance technique ciblée aux pays (TCA) est octroyée sous forme de ressources destinées aux partenaires présents dans les pays. La TCA est un élément du cadre d’engagement avec les partenaires (PEF) de Gavi. Le plan de TCA d’un pays est établie selon les besoins exprimés du dit pays lors de l’évaluation conjointe. Un plan comprend une liste d’activités, d’étapes clés, et un budget pour une année dite. L’assistance technique est un soutien non financier fourni par des spécialistes. Elle peut revêtir plusieurs formes : partage d’information et de savoir-faire, formation et services-conseils.
L’assistance technique fournie dans le cadre du PEF est appelée aide ciblée aux pays. Ce type de soutien vise principalement à payer le personnel basé en permanence dans les bureaux pays des partenaires. Il repose sur la demande et les besoins identifiés par les pays eux-mêmes.

Targeted country assistance (TCA) are resources provided to in-country partners under Gavi’s partners’ engagement framework (PEF). A country’s TCA plan is based on needs expressed by the country during the joint appraisal discussions. It includes sets of activities, milestones and budget for a given year.Technical assistance is non-financial support provided by specialists. It can take the form of sharing information and expertise, training and consulting services.
The technical assistance provided through PEF is called targeted country assistance (TCA). This type of support mainly consists of staff permanently based in partners’ country offices. It is based on the demand and needs identified by the countries themselves.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Supply chain
v) HSS2 supported CCE deployment and rehabilitation completed and evaluation report submitted

comment.narrative: 20 Ice Lined Refrigerators, 78 Icepack freezers, 224 Solar Direct Drive (SDD) including assorted spare parts and accessories, Voltage Stabilizers, Temperature monitoring devices procured and distributed to 22 provinces through technical & logistic supports. As of October 90 CCEs installed and commissioned and the remaining ongoing. Process slowed down due to COVID-19 cases surge, movement restrictions of technicians etc.

title.narrative: i) CCE inventory tool updated and semiannual CCE inventory available. ii) CCEOP supported equipment rollout completed, evaluation report submitted. iii) HSS2 supported CCE deployment plan finalized for completing the CCE rehabilitation iv) iSCM temperature monitoring study started.

comment.narrative: i) 2021 CCE inventory has been updated regularly to monitor the impact of ongoing rehabilitation and to monitor the iSCM performances. The recent inventory updated in June 2021, analyzed and report presented in the NLWG. ii) 98% CCEOP equipment rollout completed, awaiting evaluation on the 30th of June 2021. iii) HSS2 supported CCE rollout ongoing, where, 224 SDD distributed nationwide as per final ODP in June 2021, awaiting installation. iv) Temp monitoring study delayed due the COVID-19 Vaccine roll out activities.

title.narrative: WHO : Health Information Systems (Data)
Meeting conducted.

target.value: Second digital health workshop building on recommendations from first workshop - to be defined further once final report and recommendations completed.

comment.narrative: Digital Helath Workshop could not be conducted due to COVID-19 restrictions

title.narrative: UNICEF : Demand Promotion & ACSM
A flip chart developed for immunization awareness building in communities, to be used by the health facility staffs during community outreach sessions and at health facility sessions.

comment.narrative: Finalization and printing of flipchart artwork has been delayed due to COVID-19 response and vaccine rollout priorities . It is planned to completed and distributed by Oct 2021
Finalization and printing of flipchart artwork has been delayed due to COVID-19 response and vaccine rollout priorities . It is planned to completed and distributed by Oct 2021

target.value: Technical assistance to Health Promotion Unit in NDOH and Health Promotion officers in PHA to coordinate the planning, designing and monitoring the implementation of Advocacy, Communication and Social Mobilisation (ACSM) interventions for immunisation programme: i) Support Health promotion branch to develop and filed test communicaiton message for immunization demand generation; ii) Technical support to national health promotion branch to develop technical capacity of provincial health promotion officers; ii) Support national and provincial health promotion office to develop IEC materials for immunziaiton programme; iii) Support provinces to strenthen immunizaiton advocacy and demend gerenation skill among the district and health facility staffs.

comment.narrative: To be reprogrammed/deferred to 2022 TCA milestone and UNICEF Annual Work Plan due to the repurposing of TA for ongoing COVID19 vaccine rollout activities.

title.narrative: IEC materials developed

comment.narrative: IEC material has been developed for provinces, and in usage. More Printing in progress.

title.narrative: NGO/CSO mapping developed

comment.narrative: Mapping conducted in 2020 for CSO and Faith-based organizations. To be updated by August 2021

title.narrative: Plan to overcome vaccine demand-related barriers in high risk communities developed

comment.narrative: Partnership with CSO is being developed for the implementation of community engagement approach in four high risk provinces.

title.narrative: ii) At least two Provinces will have Province-specific ACSM plans (based on the National Strategy) in place with specific interventions to build demand for RI services and clear plan to invest available resources and partners to strengthen these services through engagement of decision makers, leaders, and other partners (EHP & Gulf). iii) CSO partners started immunization community awareness activities in 2 provinces (EHP & Gulf).

comment.narrative: Provincial plan is available. Partnership Agreement signed with Save the Children for rollout and implement the ACSM plan and activities from Dec.2021. Partnership Agreement signed with Save the Children signed, fund had been proved and activities will start in Dec.2021

title.narrative: A strategic and operational guideline on advocacy and leveraging of resources for immunisation developed based on the experience and evidence on implementing the national and provincial advocacy meetings and partnerships events.

target.value: Longer-term technical assistance to NDOH & provincial Health Promotion Units and EPI Units to coordinate the planning, designing and monitoring the implementation of Advocacy, Communication and Social Mobilisation (ACSM) interventions for national immunisation programme: i) Technical support to develop and roll out the implementation of ACSM strategic plan; ii) Tehcnical support on ACSM institutional capacity building of health promotion units at national and provincial levels; iii) Support to strenthen advocacy and demend gerenation activities for immunisation services.

comment.narrative: Operational guideline developed for rollout along with COVID19 advocacy and social mobilization activities at national and provincial levels.

Rollout of provincial operational guidelines and conduct of the advocacy meetings have been delayed due to COVID-19 pandemic response and vaccine rollout priorities. It is planned to be completed by Oct 2021.

Rollout of provincial operational guidelines and conduct of the advocacy meetings have been delayed due to COVID-19 pandemic response and vaccine rollout priorities. It is planned to be completed by Oct 2021.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Programme Implementation/Coverage & Equity
Plan developed to reach out most poorly covered geographical areas based on 2020 coverage analysis.

target.value: Technical support to implement equity-focused immunisation programmes: i) Update immunisation coverage and equity status 2020 using NHIS data on coverage, cold chain inventory, HR status, and outreach activities to identify most deprived rural districts and urban areas. ii) Assist provinces to deveop and implement equity improvement plan to improve coverage in most underserved communities in 4 provinces. iii) Assist PHA to develop EPI microplan focusing the hard to reach communities are captured. iv) Assist PHA in technical skill building of the district and health facility managers and health workers on immunization service delivery in association with WHO and other immunization support providers. v) Intensify supportive supervision, monitoring and mentoring of mid level and service delivery level immunizaiton managers.

comment.narrative: Immunization coverage and health & immunization system data analyzed in 2021 taking into consideration of the 2020 immunization performance. Plan and strategy developed to improve equity focused immunization programming and catch up activities in Western & Madang provinces in addition to continuing efforts in Jiwaka and Central provinces in 2021.

target.value: Technical support to implement equity-focused immunisation programmes: i) Update immunisation coverage and equity status 2020 using NHIS data on coverage, cold chain inventory, HR status, and outreach activities to identify most deprived rural districts and urban areas. ii) Assist provinces to deveop and implement equity improvement plan to improve coverage in most underserved communities in 4 provinces. iii) Assist PHA to develop EPI microplan focusing the hard to reach communities are captured. iv) Assist PHA in technical skill building of the district and health facility managers and health workers on immunization service delivery in association with WHO and other immunization support providers. v) Intensify supportive supervision, monitoring and mentoring of mid level and service delivery level immunizaiton managers.

comment.narrative: Immunization coverage and health & immunization system data analyzed in 2021 taking into consideration of the 2020 immunization performance. Plan and strategy developed to improve equity focused immunization programming and catch up activities in Western & Madang provinces in addition to continuing efforts in Jiwaka and Central provinces in 2021.

title.narrative: Detailed PNG Immunisation Road-Map 2021-2025 developed, finalised and endorsed.

comment.narrative: The NIS contains the detailed roadmap to iSCM and immunization demand generation plan with strategies, cost calculation, monitoring plan etc for the period of 2021-25. During the NIS 2021-25 development process in 2021, in collaboration with other partners (WHO & CHAI), it was ensured to analyze the current & previous situation on immunization performance indicators and mapping has been incorporated for immunization financing, system strengthening, sustainability and ownership by the programme with particular focus on cold chain system strengthening, vaccine availability and system strengthening for vaccine uptake in the communities.

The NIS contains the detailed roadmap to iSCM and immunization demand generation plan with strategies, cost calculation, monitoring plan etc for the period of 2021-25. During the NIS 2021-25 development process in 2021, in collaboration with other partners (WHO & CHAI), it was ensured to analyze the current & previous situation on immunization performance indicators and mapping has been incorporated for immunization financing, system strengthening, sustainability and ownership by the programme with particular focus on cold chain system strengthening, vaccine availability and system strengthening for vaccine uptake in the communities.

title.narrative: CDC : Programme Implementation/Coverage & Equity
Second year program evaluation completed

target.value: 8 STOP consultants, funded by Gavi, to provide in-country continuous support, technical assistance, capacity building or activities in support of national EPI programs. CDC funds will support 3 or 4 additional STOP consultants.

comment.narrative: Minor Delays In progress. Due to Covid-19, the program evaluation has not be completed. However the eight STOP consultants in PNG supported activities such as surveillance, data collection and analysis, monitoring, logistics (cold chain), capacity-building, social mobilization and advocacy, microplanning, and stakeholder/partner engagement for routine immunization, immunization campaigns, outbreak response, and vaccine introduction in the following provinces: East Sepik, Sandaun (West Sepik), Madang, Southern Highlands, Morobe, Central, Eastern Highlands, Jiwaka, and Chimbu (Simbu). They have conducted 1,057 total health facility visits, trained 593 total staff informally ?on-the-job? via supportive supervision, and 1,182 staff in formal group sessions. On average, STOP consultants spent over one-third (35%) of their time conducting coronavirus-related activities, one-quarter (25%) on polio, and the remaining 40% on other VPDs such as measles, tetanus, and rubella

target.value: 8 STOP consultants, funded by Gavi, to provide in-country continuous support, technical assistance, capacity building or activities in support of national EPI programs. CDC funds will support 3 or 4 additional STOP consultants.

comment.narrative: Minor Delays on conducting program evaluation. STOP membes stayed in country for most of 2020, had a break in January and returned to country. Evaluation planned for q 4 2021

target.value: 8 STOP consultants, funded by Gavi, to provide in-country continuous support, technical assistance, capacity building or activities in support of national EPI programs. CDC funds will support 3 or 4 additional STOP consultants.

comment.narrative: Minor Delays on conducting program evaluation. STOP membes stayed in country for most of 2020, had a break in January and returned to country. Evaluation planned for q 4 2021

title.narrative: WHO : Programme Implementation/Coverage & Equity
Field work conducted as planned

target.value: Logistics support to STOP team members for travel and supportive supervision

comment.narrative: STOP team conducted field supervision and mentoring of district supervisors in their assigned provinces on an average of 2 days per week. This resulted in higher quality implementation of COVID19 vaccine roll out, RI and VPD surveillance.

target.value: Logistics support to STOP team members for travel and supportive supervision

comment.narrative: STOP team conducted field supervision and mentoring of district supervisors in their assigned provinces on an average of 2 days per week. This resulted in higher quality implementation of COVID19 vaccine roll out, RI and VPD surveillance.

title.narrative: Provide technical support to the National EPI team of NDoH to plan and prepare for subnational EPI review meetings/workshops

target.value: ? Support the National and Provincial Health Team in all aspects of EPI planning, implementation and monitoring ? Coordinate with NDoH to organize and conduct supportive supervisory visits to provinces and districts to improve the performance of EPI programme ? Collaborate with partners UNICEF, Immunization Support Providers (ISPs) and PPF (DFAT, GAVI and MFAT) to support the implementation of the Accelerated Routine EPI Strengthening Programme in 8 PPF supported provinces ? Organize trainings on immunization and VPD surveillance at national and sub-national level ? Support the EPI program at the national and subnational level to ensure data analysis and management ? Support provincial health team to strengthen Vaccine Preventable Disease Surveillance system at the sub national level ? Collaborate with CDC to support STOP programme implementation and work directly with STOP team members as first level supervisor, including STOP ISDS team.

comment.narrative: Techncal support is given to the National EPI team on daily basis. There is regular monthly analysis of the RI data and information is used to plan corrective action.

target.value: ? Support the National and Provincial Health Team in all aspects of EPI planning, implementation and monitoring ? Coordinate with NDoH to organize and conduct supportive supervisory visits to provinces and districts to improve the performance of EPI programme ? Collaborate with partners UNICEF, Immunization Support Providers (ISPs) and PPF (DFAT, GAVI and MFAT) to support the implementation of the Accelerated Routine EPI Strengthening Programme in 8 PPF supported provinces ? Organize trainings on immunization and VPD surveillance at national and sub-national level ? Support the EPI program at the national and subnational level to ensure data analysis and management ? Support provincial health team to strengthen Vaccine Preventable Disease Surveillance system at the sub national level ? Collaborate with CDC to support STOP programme implementation and work directly with STOP team members as first level supervisor, including STOP ISDS team.

comment.narrative: Techncal support is given to the National EPI team on daily basis. There is regular monthly analysis of the RI data and information is used to plan corrective action.

title.narrative: WHO : Data
Data desk review or triangulation analysis performed (coverage, surveillance, operational, others)

target.value: Support PHA to implement accelerated RI and VPD surveillance and improve data quality

comment.narrative: Subnational consultants have provided technical assistance to the PHA to improve the timeliness, completeness and overall quality of both RI data and VPD surveillance data. The subnational consultants mentor both health information officers and surveillance officers to guide them on improving data quality that is reported into the NHIS and used for case based surveillance.

title.narrative: WHO : Service Delivery
Tools and approaches developed to improve and sustain quality and safety of immunisation services

target.value: "Work with the Government to develop and operationalize the National Immunization Strategy that will provide a framework for the workplans of next 5 years. ? Provide technical advice to the government and international partners on the planning and implementation of the deployment of COVID-19 vaccine ? Review and assist in the development of national and subnational level guidelines for AEFI surveillance and VPD surveillance ? Engage in strategic level dialogue to influence national strategy on AEFI, MR risk assessment, MR campaign, IPV 2nd dose introduction ? Support the National Department of Health to improve the capacity of the national and subnational immunization teams in immunization program planning, implementation and monitoring ? Work with government, partners, and WHO regional staff in coordinating technical and financial assistance to the national immunization program. ? Supervise the CDC STOP team

comment.narrative: Refresher training has been delivered on the topic of Injection Safety to all provincial EPI focal persons and this training has been cascaded down as part of the COVID-19 vaccine roll out training

title.narrative: Service delivery related barriers of missed communities to access immunisation services identified and prioritized

target.value: Support the National and Provincial Health Team in all aspects of EPI planning, implementation and monitoring ? Support the Public Health Team at the Sub National Level to form Provincial EPI Program Management Committee ? Organize Mid-year Review of EPI programme for sub national EPI staff on intensification of EPI activities ? Support for the implementation of the Catch up RI activities in low performing provinces and districts, MR campiagn and IPV second dose introduction ? Support the EPI program at the national and sub national level to ensure data analysis and management ? Support provincial health team to strengthen Vaccine Preventable Disease Surveillance system at the sub national level ? Support the development of NDVP for COVID vaccine rollout and support vaccination rollout ? Conduct field supervisory support to CDC STOP team

comment.narrative: Subnational support has been provided to individual Provincial Operations Centers to increase capacity for monitoring and supervision of both RI and the COVID-19 vaccine introduction. In addition, on the job training is conducted at district and HF level for enhancing capacity for VPD surveillance. Two rounds of the RI catch up activity in lower performing provinces were planned and are currently underway. Regular meetings were conducted with the pertinent provincial officers to plan and monitor the activity.

target.value: "Work with the Government to develop and operationalize the National Immunization Strategy that will provide a framework for the workplans of next 5 years. ? Provide technical advice to the government and international partners on the planning and implementation of the deployment of COVID-19 vaccine ? Review and assist in the development of national and subnational level guidelines for AEFI surveillance and VPD surveillance ? Engage in strategic level dialogue to influence national strategy on AEFI, MR risk assessment, MR campaign, IPV 2nd dose introduction ? Support the National Department of Health to improve the capacity of the national and subnational immunization teams in immunization program planning, implementation and monitoring ? Work with government, partners, and WHO regional staff in coordinating technical and financial assistance to the national immunization program. ? Supervise the CDC STOP team

comment.narrative: The National Immunization Strategy has been finalized and adopted by the Senior Executive Management Committee. This will serve as a framework of immunization workplan over the next 5 years and may guide the development of the Gavi Full Portfolio Planning. The National Deployment and Vaccination Plan was revised in August 2021 to reflect the second phase of the COVID-19 vaccine roll out and the VDI team continue to assist government to deploy COVID-19 vaccine in PNG. Guidelines for AEFI surveillance have been developed with focus on COVID-19 vaccines but also applicable for the RI. A VPD surveillance guideline specific for PNG has been written. A national MR SIA is planned for implementation in the 4th quarter of 2022 and planning for the Gavi MR grant application has started and currently in the initial stage of development. The WHO VDI team conducted provincial visits to support provinces for capacity building in RI in East Sepik, Enga, and Gulf provinces. The WHO VDI team supported the government to develop grant proposals for funds to implement the COVID-19 vaccine deployment and the IPV2 introduction. The introduction of 2nd dose IPV has progressed, and currently national and provincial level health officers have received training on technical aspects of introducing the vaccine. Data recording tools have been developed and will be printed and distributed to all provinces. Provinces have begun administering the 2nd dose of IPV in the past few months. Supportive supervision and mentoring have been provided to six STOP team consultants.

title.narrative: Support the development of NDVP for the rollout of COVID vaccine

target.value: Support the National and Provincial Health Team in all aspects of EPI planning, implementation and monitoring ? Support the Public Health Team at the Sub National Level to form Provincial EPI Program Management Committee ? Organize Mid-year Review of EPI programme for sub national EPI staff on intensification of EPI activities ? Support for the implementation of the Catch up RI activities in low performing provinces and districts, MR campiagn and IPV second dose introduction ? Support the EPI program at the national and sub national level to ensure data analysis and management ? Support provincial health team to strengthen Vaccine Preventable Disease Surveillance system at the sub national level ? Support the development of NDVP for COVID vaccine rollout and support vaccination rollout ? Conduct field supervisory support to CDC STOP team

comment.narrative: THe NDVP was developed submitted and passed review by set timeline

title.narrative: World Bank : Data
Scoping exericse on digital technology options

target.value: Digital solutions for COVID-19 vaccine oversight to track vaccines into arms and dashboard for monitoring

comment.narrative: Consultations for a rapid assessment completed. A report and presentation on findings are being finalized. The team is hoping to organize a presentation on results with other development partners soon as possible as they hope to use them to inform investments.

title.narrative: Digital microplans developed

target.value: Digital solutions for COVID-19 vaccine oversight to track vaccines into arms and dashboard for monitoring

comment.narrative: TA on digital options for tracking and monitoring vaccines in PNG was completed. Discussions with Government and partners on options for implementing a digital solution, piloting and developing of digital microplans are pending.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Supply Chain & Procurement
An EVM assessment is conducted and the comprehensive Improvement Plan (cIP) developed.

comment.narrative: The EVM assessment has been pushed to 2021-22, due to the delayed implementation of CCEOP and HSS2 supported CCE rehabilitation, as well as due to COVID19 pandemic. The EVM assessment operation plan is now being developed, with a view to conduct it in Q4 2021 and Q1 2022.

The EVM assessment has been pushed to 2021-22, due to the delayed implementation of CCEOP and HSS2 supported CCE rehabilitation, as well as due to COVID19 pandemic. The EVM assessment operation plan is now being developed, with a view to conduct it in Q4 2021 and Q1 2022.

target.value: Support NDOH Health Facility Standard Branch, National Immunisation Programme, provincial health authorities and immunisation stakeholders on strengthening immunisation Supply Chain and Logistics Management (iSCM): i) Technical assistance to implement the CCEOP-ODP and PSR-iSCM activities including distribution, installation & commissioning of CCEs at health facilities in provinces, monitoring the functionality of the equipment guided by the CCEOP Project Managemet Team (PMT), capacity building and mentoring of the biomedical technicians on CCE maintenance in the provinces; ii) Effective functioning of National Logistics Working Group (NLWG) to guide and monitor the implementation of the immunisation supply chain logistics management (iSCLM) and strengtheing the iSCLM systems; iii) Technical assistance to ensure Effective Vaccine Management (EVM) at all levels of supply chain and develop semi-annual Cold Chain Equipment (CCE) inventory; iv) Tehcnical assistance to procurement services of vaccines, cold chain and other immunisation supplies. v) Monitoring iSCM data management guided by the newly developped SOPs to improve vaccine distribution, temperature monitoirng with low and high alarm, stock management, and wastage. vi) Contribute to the overall supply chain reform agenda of the health sector guided by the the iSCM HR/Data assessment recommendations.

comment.narrative: To be reprogrammed/deferred to 2022 TCA milestone and UNICEF Annual Work Plan due to the repurposing of TA for ongoing COVID19 vaccine rollout activities.

title.narrative: WHO : Programme Management - LMC
Provide leadershop and guidance to STOP team members to ensure their optimal output towards building capacity of subnational teams

target.value: ? Work with the Government in the development of national policies, strategies, and plans to improve access to and coverage of immunization services, increase programme impact and strengthen the quality of services, injection safety and vaccines ? Provide technical advice to the government and international partners on the design, implementation, and evaluation of immunization program ? Support the Government to develop and evaluate strategies for improving vaccination coverage and quality of services ? Review and assist in the development of national and subnational level guidelines ? Engages in strategic level dialogue to influence national policy and strategy on AEFI, NITAG, MR risk assessment, MR campaign, new vaccines introduction ? Support the National Department of Health to improve the capacity of the national immunization team in all aspects of immunization programme planning, implementation and monitoring ? Leads the WHO EPI country team to develop and execute WHO work plans and ensures that monitoring mechanisms to be set up to track and evaluate the success. ? Work with government, partners, and WHO regional and head quarter staff in coordinating technical and financial assistance to the national immunization program. Coordination, collaboration, partnership, and advocacy with the Government, partners and other WHO staff to ensure sustainable financing for immunization programme to address coverage and impact of the programme. ? Coordinate partners (GAVI, US-CDC, World Bank, ADB, DFAT, UNICEF, OSF) inputs to ensure optimal and efficient use of financial and human resources through Interagency Coordination Committee (ICC) as well as convene other ad hoc meetings as needed. ? Supervise the CDC STOP team

comment.narrative: STOP team members have completed the half year mark 2021 and have made signficant contributions to COVID-19 vaccine rollout, RI system strengthening and VPD surveillance system strengthening

target.value: ? Work with the Government in the development of national policies, strategies, and plans to improve access to and coverage of immunization services, increase programme impact and strengthen the quality of services, injection safety and vaccines ? Provide technical advice to the government and international partners on the design, implementation, and evaluation of immunization program ? Support the Government to develop and evaluate strategies for improving vaccination coverage and quality of services ? Review and assist in the development of national and subnational level guidelines ? Engages in strategic level dialogue to influence national policy and strategy on AEFI, NITAG, MR risk assessment, MR campaign, new vaccines introduction ? Support the National Department of Health to improve the capacity of the national immunization team in all aspects of immunization programme planning, implementation and monitoring ? Leads the WHO EPI country team to develop and execute WHO work plans and ensures that monitoring mechanisms to be set up to track and evaluate the success. ? Work with government, partners, and WHO regional and head quarter staff in coordinating technical and financial assistance to the national immunization program. Coordination, collaboration, partnership, and advocacy with the Government, partners and other WHO staff to ensure sustainable financing for immunization programme to address coverage and impact of the programme. ? Coordinate partners (GAVI, US-CDC, World Bank, ADB, DFAT, UNICEF, OSF) inputs to ensure optimal and efficient use of financial and human resources through Interagency Coordination Committee (ICC) as well as convene other ad hoc meetings as needed. ? Supervise the CDC STOP team

comment.narrative: STOP team members have completed the half year mark 2021 and have made signficant contributions to COVID-19 vaccine rollout, RI system strengthening and VPD surveillance system strengthening

title.narrative: Develop PNG cMYP 2021-2025 draft document by Q4 and ensure alignment with National Health Plan

target.value: ? Work with the Government in the development of national policies, strategies, and plans to improve access to and coverage of immunization services, increase programme impact and strengthen the quality of services, injection safety and vaccines ? Provide technical advice to the government and international partners on the design, implementation, and evaluation of immunization program ? Support the Government to develop and evaluate strategies for improving vaccination coverage and quality of services ? Review and assist in the development of national and subnational level guidelines ? Engages in strategic level dialogue to influence national policy and strategy on AEFI, NITAG, MR risk assessment, MR campaign, new vaccines introduction ? Support the National Department of Health to improve the capacity of the national immunization team in all aspects of immunization programme planning, implementation and monitoring ? Leads the WHO EPI country team to develop and execute WHO work plans and ensures that monitoring mechanisms to be set up to track and evaluate the success. ? Work with government, partners, and WHO regional and head quarter staff in coordinating technical and financial assistance to the national immunization program. Coordination, collaboration, partnership, and advocacy with the Government, partners and other WHO staff to ensure sustainable financing for immunization programme to address coverage and impact of the programme. ? Coordinate partners (GAVI, US-CDC, World Bank, ADB, DFAT, UNICEF, OSF) inputs to ensure optimal and efficient use of financial and human resources through Interagency Coordination Committee (ICC) as well as convene other ad hoc meetings as needed. ? Supervise the CDC STOP team

comment.narrative: The final draft of the National Immunzation Strategy has been prepared and is awaiting reveiw by Senior Executive Committee

title.narrative: WHO
Training of staff on AEFI surveillance and establishing provincial AEFI response teams in 2 Gavi supported Provinces to stregnthen RI

target.value: Establishment and support of Adverse Events Following Immunization (AEFI) Surveillance and response team at the national and sub national level

comment.narrative: AEFI surveillance training was conducted as part of the preparation for COVID-19 vaccine roll out. Provincial AEFI COmmittees ahve been establisted and Workshop on Causality completed for the National AEFI COmmittee.

title.narrative: Rota Virus Surveillance (Goroka) and IB-VPD surveillance (PMGH) will be functional in the country

target.value: Support RV hospital-based surveillance in Goroka, Eastern Highlands Province and IB-VPD surveillance at the Port Moresby General Hospital in Port Moresby

comment.narrative: Both IMR Goroka and PMGH have been overburdened with duties related to the COVID-19 response. Other lab surveillance activities have been given less attention.

title.narrative: VPD surveillance established and training conducted in 6 provinces and corresponding districts

target.value: Support NDOH to strengthen VPD surveillance network at the provincial and district level

comment.narrative: On the job training ffor VPD surveillance continues at the subnational level. When possible this is integrated with the training for COVID-19 surveillance. Training workshops specific for VPD surveillance could not be conducted as planned due to COVID-19 response

title.narrative: NITAG feasibility assessment will be done

target.value: Establishment of NITAG and it's strengthening activities

comment.narrative: This activity has been delayed due to COVID-19 pandemic response

title.narrative: World Bank : Demand Promotion & ACSM
Survey and implementation tools adapted to PNG context

target.value: Facebook survey on vaccine hesitancy, misinformation and shaping of COVID-19 vaccine messages

comment.narrative: ? The survey, implemented in collaboration with the Mind Behavior and Development Unit in the Poverty GP has been adapted to PNG context and translated. The FB survey targets a minimum of 5,000 respondents across demographic groups. It has been launched and over 1,000 responses received so far. The survey team anticipates running the survey for about 2 weeks or longer depending on how soon target respondent numbers are reached. The exercise aims to inform the next phase of work which will focus on fine tuning key messages. ? As a part of this exercise a brief collating various surveys collecting information on vaccine hesitancy in PNG has been written as well ? this work is supported in coordination with the high frequency phone survey.

title.narrative: First round of survey completed

target.value: Facebook survey on vaccine hesitancy, misinformation and shaping of COVID-19 vaccine messages

comment.narrative: This activity was completed. There is also additional work that might be done on a research experiment testing and developing a health worker toolkit/aide to manage patients with vaccine hesitancy.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Service Delivery

i) Strategic planning documentation (EVM-IP, CIP, cold chain rehabilitation plan) supported and submitted to MoH. ii) National Logistic Working Group funtioned with strategic and technical support to oversee the cold chain rehabilitation. immunizaiton supply chain iii) NDOH completed forecast of vaccine for 2022

comment.narrative: 2022 EVM Assessment operation plan has been developed and submitted to NDOH, which is under costing now. Cold chain rehabilitation plan and ODPs already updated, submitted, approved and currently being implemented. NLWG is fully functional and overseeing the cold chain equipment rehabilitation and routine and COVID19 vaccine distribution throughout the country. One NLWG meeting held in October 2021. In collaboration between NDOH and UNICEF, the immunization forecast for 2022 has been developed, submitted to SD, currently at final stage.

title.narrative: Systems in place to track vaccine stocks at all levels and corrective measures undertaken

comment.narrative: Both dashboard (ViVa for national store) and physical stock tracking (for national & sub-national levels) of vaccines are in place and functioning well. The dashboard is real-time and the physical stock count is conducted once in a month. The sub-national stock counts are still irregular and incomplete. Nonetheless, the physical stock counts are the basis of vaccine replenishment activities for different store levels.

title.narrative:
iii) At least 2 unreached/ underserved urban settlement reach 80% of never vaccinated children with a doses of Penta, PCV, OPV and MR vaccines in NCD province.
iv) At least 2 rural underserved settlement reach 80% of never vaccinated children with a doses of Penta, PCV, OPV and MR vaccines in Central and Jiwaka province.
v) EPI micro planning proccess supported in 4 provinces in association with PHA, WHO and PPF ISP partners (NCD, Central, Jiwaka and Simbu provinces)

target.value: Technical support to improve coverage and equity in immunisation programmes in selected provinces: i) Analyze immunization coverage and health system data to identify the most marginalized communities. ii) Provide tehcnical assistance to provinces to deveop microplan for improving coverage and equity in most underserved communities in 4 provinces. iii) Assist PHA to develop EPI microplan focusing the hard to reach communities are captured. v) Intensify supportive supervision, monitoring and mentoring of mid level and service delivery level immunizaiton managers.

comment.narrative: Two urban settlements in NCD conducted equity focused microplanning and conducted mobile session and reached 243 children in 2021. Two rural districts/communities WHP and Central provinces conducted equity focused microplanning and conducted mobile session and reached 1,761 children in 2021, of them, 1,393 were zero dose children. Technical support provided for development of equity focused routine immunization micro planning to NCD, Central, Jiwaka and Simbu provinces.

title.narrative:
i) Immunisation coverage and health system data analyzed for the entire country, marginalized provinces identified and operation plan developed to improve coverge and equity in 2 provinces.
ii) Immunizaiton in practice training supported, facilitated and completed in two provinces in association with other partners.

target.value: Technical support to improve coverage and equity in immunisation programmes in selected provinces: i) Analyze immunization coverage and health system data to identify the most marginalized communities. ii) Provide tehcnical assistance to provinces to deveop microplan for improving coverage and equity in most underserved communities in 4 provinces. iii) Assist PHA to develop EPI microplan focusing the hard to reach communities are captured. v) Intensify supportive supervision, monitoring and mentoring of mid level and service delivery level immunizaiton managers.

comment.narrative: i) Immunization coverage and health & immunization system data analyzed in 2021 taking into consideration of the 2020 immunization performance. Plan and strategy developed to improve equity focused immunization programming and catch up activities in Western & Madang provinces in addition to continuing efforts in Jiwaka and Central provinces in 2021. ii) Immunization in practice training was conducted and supported in Central province in 2021.

title.narrative: CDC : Health Information Systems (Data)
Complete year one of field activities in selected provinces

target.value: Introduction of STOP Immunization and Surveillance Data Specialist (ISDS)like intervention 5 STOP ISDS and 1 ISDS Coordinator deployed to priority provinces to improve immunization and VPD surveillance data management, quality and use, through sustained supportive supervision

Introduction of STOP Immunization and Surveillance Data Specialist (ISDS)like intervention 5 STOP ISDS and 1 ISDS Coordinator deployed to priority provinces to improve immunization and VPD surveillance data management, quality and use, through sustained supportive supervision

Core team trained on key DHIS2 skills

target.value: Support configuration and installation of DHIS2

title.narrative: DHIS2 installed and configured Costed scale up plan exist
